They're fractals.  Visual representations of mathematic equations.  The game is totally brilliant.  I mean, look at it, it's like a DNA molecule or something... And in truth, the fractals are beautiful. Alex turns back to Nick.  And for the first time, Nick st It's clear that Alex is upset.
Something weird's happening. Nick sits down on his bed.
What do you mean by "weird"?

Greg never came home.  A few hours is one thing, Nick, but this is different. Something's happened to him. Alex glances at the computer monitor again.  On the lower is a little pulsing GREEN light, on and off, on and off,
Can you turn off the game?
I'm in the middle of it...
(upset)
Turn if off! Nick is taken aback, but he rises and turns off the compu And this time, the game stays off.  Nick comes back to th
Happy?
No. (frustrated)
Look, I know you're not going to believe me, but listen anyway... (carefully)
I think the game's alive somehow. The look on Nick's face says it all.  He moves to speak a
(continuing)

No, wait.  Just listen.  I hooked it up earlier tonight, and it said my name.  As soon as I turned it on, Nick.  It said my name.  How could it know?  And then, I asked it where Greg was, and it said, "In here".
Alex, I think you're freaking out. Greg's gone, I'll give you that.  And maybe he's in trouble.  But it's not ARCADE that's doing it...
(insistent)
It is.
How?!  It's a machine, Alex. Machine's don't think.  They're not alive.  It's a good program, a brilliant program, it was designed so it would act as if it were alive, but it's not alive.
So how did it know my name, then?
(shrugs)
You imagined it. Alex is furious.  She rises and begins pacing back and fo growing louder.  She draws in close.
See, men always do this.  "Quiet down, honey.  Chill out.  Take a Valium". I'm not a fucking idiot, Nick! (screaming)
(a strained whisper)
Quiet.  I do have parents, you know. Alex spins around and points at the computer monitor.
There!
ARCADE is back on again, fractals unfolding and green mon blinking.
Okay.  Alright.  This does throw him for a second.
It turned itself back on, Nick.
No it didn't.  It's just a faulty relay or something.  It happens. Nick crosses to the monitor and flips the "OFF" switch. and again, but the game won't turn off.
It's alive, Nick.  It's listening to us ... Nick spins around, angry, maybe a little freaked out.
Just shut up!  Enough already, okay? Silence for a moment.  Nick takes a deep breath.  Over-re moment...
Sorry.  Maybe I need the Valium.
Call the others.  Laurie, Benz... Nick acquiesces.  He pulls out his phone and punches in a
I'll try Stilts.  He's got insomnia. Nick and Alex watch each other in silence as the connecti can faintly hear the phone RINGING. No answer.
Okay...Laurie, then. Alex turns away, sinking to Nick's bed.  All the anger ha her.  She knows they won't reach them.
As he listens for an answer.  Three RINGS, four, five... Punches in the final number.
Benz... Again.  No answer. Nick hangs up and sets the phone aside.  He looks at Alex
(fatalistic)
Something's happened to them.
It's the middle of the night.  They're asleep.  Phone didn't wake them.
All of them? Nick shrugs.  He's not willing to accept anything, but he all the same.
Look, why are you fucking with me like this? Alex rises.  She's tired.  Tired and scared.
Because I didn't know where else to go.
(glances at a clock)
It's two o'clock in the morning.  Go home. Go to sleep.  We'll figure something out in the morning. And then, more for himself than for her.
(continuing)
It's not this weird.  It'll make sense. Everything gets weird this late anyway, right?
(half-hearted)
Sure. She turns and climbs back out the window onto the roof. T head back in.

If I were you, I'd think twice about playing that game again. Then she's gone.  Nick moves over and watches. NICK'S P.O.V. As Alex drops down from the roof and makes her way to Gre streetlight outside is still flickering. Nick turns back to his room.  Moves back to the monitor a fractals unfolding. He gives the "OFF" switch a token try.  Nothing.
We move in on them, losing ourselves in the labyrinth of and we...
moves down the aisles of books, dwarfed by shelves which the ceiling.  She looks a little haggard, like she hasn't She turns...
are sitting at a study cubicle.  Nick looks equally tired jawing away. As Alex joins them, Nick looks up.
Well?  Where are the others? Nick shrugs, looking elsewhere.
Sick?
Everybody's sick, huh? (glances at watch)
It's fifteen after.  We always meet here, you know that.
(to Nick)
What's her problem?
Did you play ARCADE last night?
Actually, no.  I was just telling Nick, here, that my t.v.'s busted... Alex nods, glaring at Nick.  His reluctance to believe he understandable, but the events unfolding are scaring him.
You want to hear something else, Nick? I tried to call them this morning...Greg, Benz, Laurie...  Their phones are out of order. Alex reaches into her bag and pulls out a sheet of paper
(continuing)

And then I started thinking...about everyone else that was at Dante's yesterday.  I drew up this list. DeLoach, those other jerks ... their phones are out of order too. Stilts starts HUMMING The Twilight Zone theme.
(annoyed)
So what do you want me to do? Alex softens, then reaches for Nick's hand.
We have to find out what's happened to them. I think they're gone...
No way.
If they're sick, great.  But let's make sure. (pleading)
Come on, Nick.
Okay.  We'll see what's up.  But if things are cool, I don't want to hear anything more about this.  Life's too short, know what I mean? Nick and Alex rise.
So you guys are cutting school?  Lemme go with you.
Just stay here, Stilts.
(dead serious)
And don't watch any television. Stilts thinks Nick and Alex are involved in some sort of playing along, grinning.
Oh, okay.  Forget Twilight Zone, now we're talking Outer Limits here.  We control your horizontal, your vertical...
Just do what she says, Stilts.  And if we're not back...
I'll call the National Guard.  I got it under control. (giggles)

Oh, just one more thing.  Is it a supernatural thing you guys are going off to fight, or is it aliens, like Pod People and stuff like that?  Cause there's a difference, you know.  One you need garlic and silver bullets for, the other...
(irritated)
Look at me, Stilts.  Am I laughing? The grins fades from Stilts' face.  Nick is definitely no
Just do what she said.  Don't watch television. Nick spins around and takes Alex by the arm, leading her
Nick sits in the passenger seat of Greg's car, glancing a at...

Well?
She thought Benz was at school. Alex remains calm.  She sits for a moment, staring ahead. the key in the ignition.
Where to now?
Laurie's.
Alex pulls the Skylark into Laurie's driveway.  The house You wouldn't want to live here.  Above, the sky has cloud looks like it's going to get nasty.
Come on. Nick follows Alex to the front door and Alex hits the buz

Laurie...answer...come on... Alex tries the buzzer again.  Persistently.
Shit. Alex looks close to cracking.  There's a desperation in h
This is like a movie or something.  I mean, am I paranoid or what?
It doesn't necessarily mean she's...

Let's go around back. Before Nick can stop her, Alex is running around to the b

She's here! Nick joins her at the window, peering inside. THEIR P.O.V. They are looking into a cluttered living room, dark excep that's issuing from the television.  The television faces but we can see Laurie, siting in front of it, mesmerized.

She looks like shit.  Wan, with sunken eyes and mussed up has run down her cheeks, and even now, tears are tricklin Yet despite this, there's a dazed smile on her face.  We but she seems to be talking to the television.
steps back a moment, concerned.

Laurie!
Laurie continues to watch the screen, oblivious to the re Alex TAPS the harder, using her fist now.
(louder)
Nick joins Alex now, and the two of them are banging on t There's no way in hell Laurie wouldn't be able to hear th Alex steps back from the window again, panicking.
Nick, what do we do?! Alex looks around, sees a two-by-four, and snags it.
(realizing)
No, Alex!  Alex, wait a minute... Alex swings the two-by-four like a club and SMASH!!!  Dow in a shower.

Alex and Nick enter and immediately sense that something The LIGHT from the t.v. screen continues to flicker and a electric HUM permeates the air...the sound a live wire mi the HUM seems to be mobile too, coursing through the wall around Alex and Nick. fills the screen.  Static and strange WHISPER/VOICES.  It indistinct.

Angels.  There are angels inside. But we see only static.
We have to turn it off, Laurie.  I'm turning it off... As Alex reaches for the "OFF" knob, a face coalesces out It's Greg again.
(static-laced)
Alex.  Don't leave me here.
Jesus Christ!

around the room are crackling with energy, spitting out S

moves without thinking, picking up a nearby chair and SLA television.  It EXPLODES glass, sparks, and smoke. The HUMMING stops altogether, quiet now.  And then, from once...

lies on the ground, unconscious.  Glass scattered all aro

I believe you now.  I don't know what the fuck just happened, but it did. Now let's get the hell out of here. Alex slowly rises, reluctant to leave Laurie's side.
Where do we go?
My house.  I want to try something.
As Alex and Nick pull up, the streetlights BUZZ on and of it's still daylight.  This doesn't escape Nick's notice. Alex parks the car and the two of them jump out.
Around back.
Nick leads Alex to a cellar door and down inside.
Rear the doorway is an old, paint-caked fuse box.  Nick p begins unscrewing fuses.
I'm not taking any chances. Nick steps back.
Okay.  I'm going inside.  If I'm not back out in, say, two minutes, you get the hell out of here. Alex nods.  She lifts her digital watch up and sets her t
Meet you by the car.

Alex sits on the hood of the Skylark watching the streetl wary eye.  She glances at her watch.  About a minute and elapsed and... Here's Nick now, carrying a lap-top computer and a modem sets the equipment in the back seat.
We need to find a pay-phone.
Nick sets up his lab-top inside the phone booth as Alex w up the modem to the phone receiver and turns the machine
warms up, and in black and white, we see the same FRACTAL the lap-top and sighs.
That's what I thought.
What?
It's not just the cable system.  It's in the phone system as well, the electronic net.  It's everywhere.
Nick, what is it.
Maybe it is alive in a way...some sort of electronic intelligence.  It's like a computer virus that developed a personality or something.  It's self-replicating...it mimics life.
Like the fractals? Nick nods.  He grabs his skateboard out of the back seat curb, spinning a wheel with his finger.  He stares at the
It's growing.  Getting stronger. Maybe it's only localized now...
(catching his drift)
...but then it hits the relay stations...
Right.  And then communication satellites, and then anywhere. Alex looks up into the sky despite herself.
(disbelief)
Anywhere. (beat)
We have to stop it from getting out.
(shakes his head)
It's already out.
The Police, then...

Give me a break, Alex.  What are we going to tell them?  Excuse me, officer, but there's some sort of electronic monster loose in the phone lines.  I'd think twice about calling any of those 976 numbers...
(angry)
Then where do we go?!
I don't know. Alex stalks off a few paces.  Thinking.  Thinking...
What?
They made ARCADE.  It's still a game, right?  It thinks like a game.  Maybe it still has to play by the rules. Someone had to program it in the first place, didn't they?. At this, Nick perks up.
You mean we learn the rules...
And beat it at it's own game.
You realize that in order to do that, we'd actually have to play the game.
I was afraid you'd say that.

The SLIP-STREAM compound comprises a cluster of mirrored, antiseptic-looking buildings.  Carefully maintained green compound, dotted with perfectly positioned trees.  The wh greenery included, seems prefabricated and sterile.  We m camera, sweeping in and dropping low, across the main con stone steps to the main lobby...

Alex and Nick are moving across the lobby.  Nick is still skateboard.  The two of them look extremely out of place, rest of the people bustling around them are "dressed for THEIR P.O.V. as they approach a prefab RECEPTIONIST sitting behind and The guy's smile is so perfect he must've had it tattooed of those obnoxious phone/headsets.
May I help you?
We need to see Mr. Difford.
I see.  And do you have an appointment?
No, but it's important and if you'd...
(cutting him off)

I'm sorry, but if you don't have an appointment, I won't be able to help you. If you'd like, you can call his office from our courtesy phone outside and schedule one ... Nick reaches across the desk and snags the receptionist b jerking him forward.
(menacing)

If Difford's not out here it one minute we're calling the news and informing them that your fucking games are whispering in our ears and telling us to commit suicide. I'm talking public relations nightmare here, buddy.  Satanism, virgin sacrifices, backward messages, the whole bit. The receptionist glances at Alex who puts on a stern face Nick releases his grip.  The receptionist smooths out his smiles.
One moment please... (punches in extension)
Rachel, would you be kind enough to tell Mr. Difford that we have a situation in the lobby which requires his immediate attention? (beat)
Thank-you. The receptionist clasps his hands together and looks back
(continuing)
Mr. Difford will be right with you.
Why thank-you. Alex and Nick move away from the reception desk, having c scene.  The rest of the VISITORS watch them with curiosit
Virgin sacrifices?
(shrugs)
Drives 'em crazy every time. Nick casts his eyes over the walls where graphics from va games are displayed.  He stops on one display in particul sorts featuring the haunting face of ARCADE.
Alex and Nick turn at the sound, just in time to see Diff elevator and briskly making his way towards them.
Nick, Alex, how are we today?
How'd you know it was us?
Security camera. (points to one)
Pulled your files before I came down. Be careful what you say, kids ... I know where you live. Difford laughs and claps Nick on the back.
(continuing)
Now what seems to be the problem?
It's the game, ARCADE.
You don't like it?
That's gotta be the understatement of the century.  It's killing people. Beat.  Difford looks from Alex to Nick, and back again. H from his face.
If this is a joke, I'm not laughing.
Neither are we.  Something's wrong with the game, Mr. Difford.
(clearing his throat)
Why don't we take this into my office.
Difford closes the doors behind him.  He stares and Alex moment, assessing, calculating risks...
Talk to me.
There's something wrong with ARCADE. The game's alive somehow... At this Difford breaks into a smile.  Nick sees this and save the situation.
What Alex is trying to say is that it "seems" like it's alive.
No I'm not...
(freezing her with a stare)
We're not getting very far into the levels and we kind of thought maybe we could talk to a programmer, learn some tricks and stuff... (beat)
I mean, you don't want us kids running around school saying your game's too hard, right?
(relieved)
That's what this is all about? Tricks? Sure, I'd be happy to introduce you to ARCADE's programmer. Alex has caught on.  She shuts up for the moment.
(continuing)
Tell you what, I'll take you down to our R&D labs right now.

Hardly what you'd expect.  The lab is hopelessly cluttere whirlwind had swept inside and thrown everything helter-s leads Nick and Alex inside. A MAN sets in front of a stack on monitors.  One his head instrument...sort of an extension of the stereoscopic gog lab-coat and a SLIP-STREAM I.D. badge, but aside from tha is unkempt.  Kind of your 60s drop-out look.
This is one of our newest projects. We're trying to get rid of joy-sticks altogether ...
(nodding)
The Air-Force is working on the same thing.
(to screen)
Come on, come on... He moves his head this way and that...
A computer-animated TURTLE is crawling across the screen. "TIME'S UP" flash over.  The turtle flips onto it's back hanging out.
Shit.
(clearing his throat)
Albert... ALBERT turns around in his seat and pulls off the helmet.
(continuing)
This is Nick and Alex.  They'd like to talk to you about ARCADE.  Maybe you can give them a few programmer's secrets.
Yeah, sure.
(to Nick and Alex)
Then I leave you in capable hands. Difford exits.  Nick points to the helmet in Albert's han
Does that thing work?
Getting there.  It's more sensitive than a joy-stick.  Your video-character can respond as fast as you can. (standing)
But what can I do for you?
We're having some problems with ARCADE...
Yeah, who isn't.
What do you mean?
It's a tough game.  Hard to pin that bastard down.  Keeps on changing the rules.
We vere thinking there might be tricks. You know, surprises that you'd worked into the game...

Sure.  Every game's got 'em.  I'll start with the schematics.  I can print these up if you want. Albert moves back to the wall of monitors, then reaches f disk and inserts it into a nearby drive.  He taps a few b BINGO...
of each world/level within the ARCADE game appear on the
You've got your ten levels, right? Here they are...  Each level has an exit, only remember, the exits aren't always what they seem. (points to each one)

First one's The Blood Red Sky, then you've got The Blue Desert, Tower of Ghosts, Kingdom of the Blind...  On each world you have to find a golden key and you've only got so much time to do it in.  If you're too late, The Screamer comes.
How do you stop The Screamer?

You can't.  He gets you and you're dead. It's like time catching up with you, you know?  Like Fate.  Each level you get progressively less time to complete.  First half of the game takes place in the Wild Lands.  Then you reach Level 6, and that's the Sea of Darkness.  There's a two-headed Boatman that'll take you across if you answer his riddle right.  If you don't... He motions cutting a knife across his throat.
What's the riddle?
If I tell you, then it's no fun.
(harder)
Just tell me the fucking riddle.
Well...it involves a paradox.  You have to trick The Boatman. (beat)

Now all the while, you also have to watch your strength.  You can build that back up by catching FIREFLIES...the little glowing guys... Albert hits some keys again and Levels One through Six di they're replaced by Seven through Ten. Only instead of a Level Eleven, there's only a question matc.
(continuing)

The next half of the game takes place in ARCADE's brain, The City of Truth. It's urban scenarios, lots of metal and concrete. Screamer comes faster here.  On Level Four you can get a free life if you wait until the last possible second before exiting that world.  Gotta time it right though.
What's the question mark?
Level Ten.  That's where you've got to unlock ARCADE's heart using the keys you've found.
How do you do that?
Good question.  See, that's where the fun comes in.  ARCADE changes it every time. He's a machine without a soul. Once you give him a soul, he stops being a threat. Alex looks dejected.
But how can it change every time?
It's the game's logic core.  We actually patterned it after human brainwaves.  I mean, there's a personality in there. That's what makes it so incredible.
How the hell did you do that?

Well, we're veering into classified info here, but I'll tell you that it involved a donor.  He was dead of course, so it's not like anything unethical was happening. At this, a chill runs down Alex's spine.
Dead?
Well, brain-dead anyway.  Coma patient. It's really not all that important.
Maybe he's not dead.
He?
The donor.  Maybe he's alive inside the game.
(laughs)
And maybe you've been taking too many drugs. Nick glances at the helmet again.
Could you play ARCADE with that?
Well, technically "yes", but this is only the prototype. Nick nods and smiles, offering his hand.
Thanks, Albert.  Think you could print up those schematics?
Sure. Albert moves back to the computer console.  Meanwhile, Ni aside.
(quietly)
Go outside, get your car, and meet me out front with the engine running. And make it quick, okay?
What are you going to do?
Get that helmet.  If we're going to play ARCADE, I want every advantage possible.
Albert is oblivious to their conversation. Alex backs towards the lab doors, turns, and opens them.

as we watch Alex's Skylark speed away from us.  Shadows a across the landscape now.  Streetlights are flickering, s And night is falling.
